content.description: Let <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function. The figure above shows the graph of the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math>.
content.question: Of the following, which must be true?

choices.label: <math alttext="f prime of 0, equals, the negative of f of 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f prime of 0, is less than f of 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f prime of 0, equals f of 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f prime of 0, is greater than f of 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f prime of 0, equals f of 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
